priorVersion.title: Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRTESTCD

self.title: Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SRTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SRTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SRTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
datasetVariables.label: Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name
datasetVariables.name: SRTESTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRTEST

self.title: Skin Response Test or Examination Name

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in SRTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Wheal Diameter".
datasetVariables.label: Skin Response Test or Examination Name
datasetVariables.name: SRTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SROBJ

datasetVariables.name: SROBJ

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRSTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from SRORRES in a standard format or in standard units. SRSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in SRSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: SRSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from SRSTRESC. SRSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Results/Findings in Std. Units
datasetVariables.name: SRSTRESN

datasetVariables.name: SRLOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that SRBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: SRBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SREVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of person who provided evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: SREVAL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRTPT

datasetVariables.description:
1. Text description of time when measurement should be taken.
2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See SRTPTNUM and SRTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: SRTPT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRTPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of SRTPT to aid in sorting.

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (SRTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by SRTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: SRELTM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRTPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by SRELTM, SRTPTNUM, and SRTPT. Example: "INTRADERMAL INJECTION".
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: SRTPTREF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable SR.SRRFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/time of the reference time point, SRTPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: SRRFTDTC

description: A findings about domain for submitting dermal responses to antigens. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C112420, 2018-06-29)
